name: Unreal Gold
description: Your prison ship has crash-landed on the fastest, sleekest, most dangerous 3D world ever created. Look around, crystal clear water shimmers, shadows dance and shift, alien architecture fades into the horizon.

reviews.review_text: Great game that came at the same time as Half-Life and was a bit overshadowed by it. That was my 1st game on pc together with Half-Life and loved it at the time. Still one of my favourite games of all times and the soundtrack is awesome. Although maybe not as good as the main game, the expansion pack Return to Na-Pali is included. I personally enjoyed it. Get the HD textures pack and tweaks from the net to get the most out of it and the game is still a lot of fun to play today. It also supports widescreen 1080p resolution.
Great single player experience. Would highly recommend.

Probably one of my favorite games of all time. It's a game that's aged well. The environments are beautiful, if not anything else; the soundtrack is amazing.   Along with that, I've always loved exploring the lively world of Unreal. From a breathtaking waterfall, to a vertigo inducing sky city, to an alien mothership, this game is amazing, and I would love to see an HD remake from EPIC.
Fantastic game from the early 2000's. Unreal has a great atmosphere, a nice variety of weapons, and a fantastic soundtrack. Just remember to quicksave often!

Somewhere around 1999, I bought this game and put it on a shelf near my computer. It was my inspiration to save my money for a Voodoo 3 graphics accelerator. The day I bought the Voodoo 3 and popped it in, I loaded up Unreal. It lived up to its name. It was the most amazing thing I had ever seen at the time. Emerging from the prison ship to the planet's surface was astounding. Lighting effects, a giant waterfall with some particle effects, clouds in the sky that could obfuscate the sun, wild animals on the ground and in the air... Unreal showed us what was possible, pushing limits of systems for years after it came out, and spawning a series of games, and an everlasting engine of astounding magnitude.

Unreal Gold is THE classic first-person shooter for the late 1990s. I have been playing this game for nearly 15 years(not counting the hours listed on my profile). The graphics were stunning when the game came out, and are still pretty good, even by today's standards. The AI is smart compared with earlier shooters(and a few later ones). I really can't say anything bad about Unreal.
A classic that is still worth buying with its fun gameplay and interesting levels.
My dad likes this game

As other reviews of this game have mentioned, Unreal is phenomenal! Of the first person shooters I've played, this one is way better than most. The amazingly rich environments suck you deep into the plight of the peaceful Nali and the cruel world of their oppressors. When you awaken in your cell, you are alone, the bodies of your shipmates bloodied and lifeless. Many are torn in two. Sirens and garbled voice recordings break the uneasy silence, as you crawl through the battered remains of the ship, only to find that you are the sole survivor, lost on a planet full of hostile beings intent on your demise. That is only the beginning, though. Your travels to escape the planet will lead you through many varied locations that are very easy to differentiate from one another, each one more visually stunning than the last. That is definately one of Unreal's strong points.  The brilliant designers do not allow for the levels to become tediously repetitive. Each environment has it's own personality. Another strong point, and perhaps most important, is the enemy. Long gone are the days of Doom when enemies would simply stand their ground, and trade fire with you. These enemies are much more cunning than that. They will use cover, snipe at you from high perches, duck fire, dodge and even call for back-up if neccessary. Some of your enemies will even try to draw you into traps and ambushes.  This game is exceptionally challenging and rewarding, making most shooters pale in comparison. I was most impressed with the dramatic lighting, ambient sound and music, utilized to it's full potential, making this lengthy epic bristle with life and tension. This is an ideal purchase for anyone who does'nt already have this classic in their library. You can take or leave the included expansion pack, as it simply doesn't offer much more variety to the original experience, but don't over-look this title due to it's now ridiculously low price. For unparalleled on-line battle, check out Unreal tournament.
Childhood favourite. Must say it is one of the best FPS's of it's time. Singleplayer was fast paced awesomeness and the multiplayer was just as good!

One of my first 3DFX games that I specifically sought out a second Voodoo 2 for a SLI Glide setup. Glorious. This game as withstood the test of time and is as enjoyable & impressive now as it was back in '98.
if you like deus ex you will like the game amazing gamplay dispite how old the game is amazing soundtrack
Pretty good and challenging lone-surviving adventure with kind of a deep aesthetics. One of the those classics that changed the way we play fps games today.
Unreal had excellent graphics for its time, and I feel like it has aged well. This classic game is pretty entertaining.
Nostalgiafaggin'? You bet. This game is still fun to play over 10 years later.

This game is probrably the second best shooter ever, behind only the original Half-Life imo. It has some pretty advanced graphics for its time, thanks to the original unreal engine. You are immersed into your environment with the lighting, soundtrack, and the detailed and often sizeable levels throughout the game. Exploration is typcailly rewarded with things such as ammo, armors, or other useful items. The enemies in this game come in all shapes and sizes, from the quick Skaarj to the gigantic Titans, and tend to get more difficult to deal with the deeper you are into the game.   It certainly wont hold up to todays graphical or story-based gaming standards, but for anyone who enjoys the old school shooters this is certainly a must have.
it's a real classic game
I was 3 when I played this and it was my first pc game ever, after 10 years it's still just as amazing.
Simply. Classic.

This has always been and will always be my favourite first person shooter, and one of my all-time favourite games. I cannot think of a game that compares to Unreal. The game is so atmospheric, the planet so beautiful and haunting, the feeling of isolation and desperation coming from being the only survivor stranded on a dangerous alien world is simply amazing. The levels are generally large and often non-linear, and each encounter feels like an intense threat; the Skaarj are smart and very dangerous. And to top it all off, the music is nothing short of fantastic, it really sucks you in.  The expansion pack is meh, feel free to skip it.

Unreal Gold is a slightly older version of Unreal Tournament with 2 single player campaigns and regular bot deathmatch.  It is not the first 3D FPS but it is the most important one because of its ground braking physics engine . Unreal is the point where modern FPS was born and the engine itself became groundwork for modern game developing tools .   These days we take much of what Unreal introduced for granted as a base line for what FPS should be. However back then it was ambitious to create a fluid FPS game in 3D . There isn't much I can say about gameplay as the game comes down to walking,shooting and pressing buttons .  I will say that there are some jump scares with predators XD This is the FPS that introduced a lot of enviromental 3D events . Sometimes lights will go off and some alien will brake through wall so he can kill you (these days it happens all the time right)  If a game like this came out today (and they have) I would not like it . However in respect to timeframe it is made Unreal was THE FPS . Right now game is $10 on sale and I would not recommend it for someone new to the series just because it is a generic game in 2015 and probably not worth it .  Perhaps this game isn't very good for new audience but if you are interested in the roots of FPS genre give it a try on sale .It has a charm that never fades away .

Not only one of my all-time favorite games now, but I'll even say one of the greatest, most impressive games ever ♥♥♥♥ING made. The original Unreal is a masterpiece in every sense of the word. Lots of awesome original weapons, all with alternate fires, all super fun, and with such meaty sound design. And you gotta love those super deep-voiced grunts when you jump. Lots of fascinating enemies and NPC interactions. Really great lore and worldbuilding from the text logs you can observe, and a real sense of scale and gravitas with the story despite the complete lack of dialogue. No cutscenes, all real-time and ambient, but with sick-♥♥♥ music. Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant map design, with breathtakingly expansive levels to explore.   Aesthetically, everything in the game is just beautiful, even today. Such colorful and lush sci fi landscapes and architecture, and not just the usual everything-is-metal-and-high-tech stuff you often think of when thinking of sci fi settings. It's truly an alien world... And the enemy AI is actually challenging and crazy smart, which is just astounding considering this is a game from 1998 and how lame AI often still is today. The game is really challenging in general, and it is very long.  When I think of a true JOURNEY of a game, I think of this very Unreal right here. No ♥♥♥♥ing Tournament, just plain-♥♥♥ original Unreal 1 right the ♥♥♥♥ here. It is positively... UNREAL, the places you'll go in this game. The very definition of an adventure. People always going on about how great Half-life is, but I honestly feel this game might be a notch or two more amazing than Half-life, for the same sorts of reasons Half-life 1 was/is awesome. And I do ♥♥♥♥ing LOVE Half-life. This game... This game gave me feelings, guys. Real ♥♥♥♥ing feelings. I was truly in awe. This game should be recognized more, and it has my 100% recommendation, especially considering the price.   The expansion, Return to Na Pali gives a bunch more levels for even more Unreal goodness and continues the story directly where Unreal 1 left off, but the player character is suddenly given a voice, and I think that goes against what the original Unreal was about. He'll (you'll) talk in between levels in some dumb kinda unncessary monologue about what just happened and what's going to happen next. So Return to Na Pali is the same fun as Unreal 1, but with some mediocre new narrative style. So even including Return to Na Pali and Unreal 2 (which goes even further into the voiced characters, try-hard hamfisted story ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t territory, and is really quite a different kind of game altogether), there truly hasn't been another game quite like Unreal since Unreal came out all these years ago, and while the Unreal Tournament games aren't bad, I think it's a damn shame Epic (Mega)Games never made another game as incredible in the way Unreal was. Here's hoping for a really good current-gen remake of some sort; this singleplayer Unreal truly deserves another chance in the spotlight. Or perhaps a whole new Unreal game altogether, if they can nail it like this one did, and take away from the stains of Return to Na Pali and Unreal 2. It is one of the most amazing experiences I've ever played, and I wish more people could understand what I'm talking about by playing the game for themselves. So go do that, reader! It's totally worth it, trust me on this one. That so few people talk about this game just astounds me. And there's also multiplayer, yes.

In Cabela's Space Hunts '98 you play as notorious monkey mangler Jane Goodall, and are exiled to the penal dread colony of Space India for your sick crimes to hunt down the legendary Old Gods so that you can replace them with newer, more approachable Gods who'll listen to your problems and actually care about you instead of ditching you on prom night for your more attractive roommate.

It's a difficult one: I'd recommend it if it was free or part of an incredibly cheap bundle, but not alone. It plays well for the most part, but doesn't have anything to hold it up against the wealth of good 'thinking man's FPS games out there. Also, whilst it starts of very good, it starts to become too repetitive (unlike Quake 2, for example), and the last level is just horrible in my opinion. However, there are some nice puzzles, and I liked it most of the way into it, however it just became a chore to complete it for the sake of it. If the Unreal bundle is about £5 then give it a try, as there's still people playing UT, UT2005 and UT3 (if you can get multiplayer to work), so it forms a fair bundle of single and multiplayer games. And in my opinion, UT was always more fun than Quake 3/Arena.

A great effort for its time and certainly a hallmark in gaming history. This game has decent graphics considering the release date, but the plot seemed non existent to me. There was no sense of pushing forward to your goal and most of the time I did not have a clue what was my goal. There were no objectives or sense of communication in the game other the transmission logs. The maps are well designed but the weapons feel like they lack power and the AI is just plain annoying, and not because its hard , because it feels like randomly spawned and shallow in existence. I cant recommend this game unfortunately because all the above and because it was a struggle to actually complete it. The game just did not draw me in with its overall atmosphere
It's called Unreal for a reason you dofus. Well the graphics HAVE aged like already-opened milk but who cares it's amazing and you should play it.

Man, I miss shooters with big, open levels to be stumbled about in. I miss ones based on the Build engine more, because they tend to be more dense, but you can't deny that the open majesty and relative simplicity of the original Unreal lends it a certain quality of alien desolation. 4/5, just for not being a corridor shooter, basically.

This was pretty much THE defining game of my childhood. Back in the day I used to host a co-op server with my own self-made levels, most of them lounge maps without any real goal to them, and my friends would always come in and play with me. The vanilla game's campaign is a very expansive and varied experience all about a prisoner trapped on a planet struggling to leave it. If you've not played this 90s gem you owe it to yourself to do so.

I'd forgotten how ridiculously long the original Unreal is.   That is not a criticism.   I'd also forgotten the entire game (including Return To Na Pali) can be played with a friend in tow. People don't seem to remember Unreal today, which is a shame, the moment when you finally emerge from the crashed Vortex Rikers into the light of an alien sun on an alien world is one of my all time favourite moments. They don't make 'em like they used to.
One of best games ever <3   11/10

More games like Unreal would make the world a better place. Although your main goal is pretty straightforward: escape a planet; this FPS adventure classic adds a beautiful complexity to its levels.  Huge open areas, great views, wonderful music, original weapons, challenging enemies, peaceful 4-armed natives praying for your dead predecessors, compelling storylines captured in books and data logs, dreaming away at seeing floating sky cities in the distance (who'd have known that back in 1998, pixels could do so much to a human being). This game deserves a remake!
A classic. Haven't played it in years. I think someone made a high res mod for it?

For anyone who played this growing up this is probably a must have. While it hasn't aged well in the slightest it's nice to remember how impressed we were back then stepping out of the spaceship into what seemed like a huge environment, and that waterfall. Even though now looking at it the landscape is sparse, blocky, and low resolution, imagination and sentimentality still fills in the blanks.  The controls aren't quite as tight as fpses nowdays, and you realise just how much you take for granted in modern games. There's no insta-kill headshots here, but there's plenty of disco coloured lighting to warm our hearts.

Unreal Gold was a mastor peice of its time. The game was amazing, too amazing. My only issue with the game is the onjectives, and the mapping,they was often confusing, and very open, Other than that Unreal Gold in a must buy for those who like games like Doom, Quake, or Half Life

holy sh*t was this a good game. I couldnt belive how good the graphics were for a game that came out in 98. better then most games i played today yeah the graphics are outdated but man the game play was fantastic. For a old game it ran flawless i was playing at 1440p @ 60 fps . I had to download the patch to get it to run the way i wanted. i would wait for it to be on sale again well worth it.

This game has by far the most impressive AI I have EVER seen in a game. Enemies actually feel threatening, and feel like they're actual players fighting you rather than a computer bot. The basic Aliens (Skaarj) will take 3-6 ROCKETS to kill, talk about tough. They will bunny hop, circle strafe, match your movements, and avoid any projectile based attacks your give and literally dodge out of the way.  Not only the AI, but the level design, music, and satisfying feel of gunplay this game delives gives it the right to be titled 'Unreal'. The graphics are kinda bleh by today's standards and it looks like a ps2 game, but this was made way back in 1998, before the ps2 even existed. This was really impressive back then.  Everything in this game is perfect. nothing even felt repetetive, which is amazing to me because normally games start to feel very repetetive to me throughout the first half of the game.  Only thing I have to complain about is how complex the level design can be, and it can confuse alot of modern gamers because they wouldn't have the gaming instints of older players that know how to explore well. Very little hand holding. Even then it's a very minor complaint.  This is by far one of my all time favorite games, if you haven't played it, I don't know if you've either never heard of any of the unreal games and have been living under a friggin rock or some crap, or you haven't played the very first game that started it all.  I reccomend this to anyone that likes fps. The multiplayer is also amazing, but Unreal Tournament was more polished, though it's multiplayer only.  GIVE THIS A SHOT IT'S WORTH EVERY PENNY I PROMISE,  10/10 would kill the Skaarj again.
